body.p:
Louisville Sep 15. 1862
To His Exy
J. F Robinson, Govr of Ky
Dear Sir

In pursuance of what I conceive to be the duty of evry loyal man at a time like this. to keep lay before the proper authorities any information which may be of public interest I respectfully beg to inform you that Isaac Everett, who is recruiting a company in or near this city is & has been a violent secessionist -- that twice he went to the southern part of the state for the purpose of joining mMorgan & on his last was brought back by his relations, At the last attempt he was brought back on Saturday
night & on Monday morning had a recruiting commission. For the truth of this you can refer to the father of the young man Isaac Everett Sr. I can produce proper evidence if necessary.

I have reason to believe that an application will be made to commission Turner Anderson of Mead Co Ky in the 17th Ky Mr T. A. is & has been a secessionist from the beginning I know it is impossible for the appointing power to know of the standing of evry applicant & conceive it to be the duty of evry loyal man to give proper information in regard to applicants who are unworthy of trust.

I am Dep marshall of the L Chancery Court & am ready to stand to the information
I give at any time & place required. I refer you to Hon J Speed, N Wolf, B Ballard & the Union men of the city generally

Very Respectfully
N. B. Gault.
N B. Gault
